step_of_the_day.title: Overcoming a defeat, failure or loss. How to recover after messing up.
step_of_the_day.content:
As former president Obama says, you won’t go through life avoiding failure. Life is complicated. Achieving
            success has its twists and turns. Mistakes are part of the process. In fact, it’s part of any learning
            process. The rocket ship that took our astronauts to the moon was off course 98% of the time, but it was
            continually receiving feedback and making adjustments that kept bringing it back on course. Similarly,
            mistakes give you feedback to help you get it right, the next time. It’s important not to be shamed or
            discouraged in this natural process

action_step:
Identify a mistake or failure that you haven’t let go of. It might have come during an interaction with
            someone, perhaps in a business or school situation. It might be a business failure or mistake that cost you
            a lot. Here are the steps for letting go:1. Experience and express whatever feelings are attached to this experience; sadness, loss, anger or
            frustration.2. Find the lesson to be learned. If there was a loss from the mistake – a cost – you want to balance this
            out with a benefit – a lesson.3. Hold the intention not to be defeated, but to rebound stronger.4. Forgive yourself and let go.
